title: China raising its retirement age may be unpopular but it's much needed, analysts say
content: Economists have long called for an overhaul of the nation's retirement age laws, currently among the world's lowest, that was set in an era with lower life expectancies.
summary: Economists have long called for an overhaul of the nation's retirement age laws, currently among the world's lowest, that was set in an era with lower life expectancies.

title: UK regulator finds Vodafone and Three merger would lead to price rises, seeks remedies for deal
content: The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) said the Vodafone and Three U.K. merger would lead to price increases for tens of millions of customers.
summary: The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) said the Vodafone and Three U.K. merger would lead to price increases for tens of millions of customers.

title: British government had 'constructive' talks with Musk's X over disinformation, minister says
content: The U.K. government has had "constructive" talks with X over the spread of misinformation and other harmful content, technology minister Peter Kyle told CNBC.
summary: The U.K. government has had "constructive" talks with X over the spread of misinformation and other harmful content, technology minister Peter Kyle told CNBC.

title: UK leads resurgence in European office investment
content: The U.K. is leading a recovery in Europe's long subdued office real estate market, with overall investment in the sector expected to pick up further in the second half of the year.
summary: The U.K. is leading a recovery in Europe's long subdued office real estate market, with overall investment in the sector expected to pick up further in the second half of the year.

title: Saudi Arabia expects to get access to Nvidia's high performance chips 'within the next year'
content: The U.S. has imposed restrictions on exports of the chips out of concerns they could be accessed by China, which is Saudi Arabia's top trading partner.
summary: The U.S. has imposed restrictions on exports of the chips out of concerns they could be accessed by China, which is Saudi Arabia's top trading partner.

title: Samsung shares fall as workers' strike at India plant continues after talks fall through
content: The strike in Samsung India follows recent wage protests in South Korea where 36,500 members from its biggest workers' union went on strike in July and August.
summary: The strike in Samsung India follows recent wage protests in South Korea where 36,500 members from its biggest workers' union went on strike in July and August.

title: Boeing factory workers strike for first time since 2008 after overwhelmingly rejecting contract
content: More than 30,000 Boeing workers were set to strike Friday, halting production of most of the company's aircraft after staff rejected a new labor contract.
summary: More than 30,000 Boeing workers were set to strike Friday, halting production of most of the company's aircraft after staff rejected a new labor contract.

title: U.S. firms say confidence in China has hit an all-time low
content: American companies in China are experiencing historically low optimism and poor profits amid geopolitical tensions and a slowing Chinese economy, surveys show.
summary: American companies in China are experiencing historically low optimism and poor profits amid geopolitical tensions and a slowing Chinese economy, surveys show.

title: This 32-year-old cashed out on over $2 million in startup equity—here are five tips on how to negotiate for more shares
content: Bhavik Vashi, 32, made over $2 million after selling his equity in software startup Anaplan. He gives four tips on how to be best positioned for a negotiation.
summary: Bhavik Vashi, 32, made over $2 million after selling his equity in software startup Anaplan. He gives four tips on how to be best positioned for a negotiation.

title: Most Gen Z Brits want to 'be their own boss' — but one expert says they'll face a reality check
content: The vast majority of Gen Z want to "be their own boss," and have no intentions of working a 9-to-5 job, a new Santander survey finds.
summary: The vast majority of Gen Z want to "be their own boss," and have no intentions of working a 9-to-5 job, a new Santander survey finds.

title: Jeep CEO enacts turnaround plan after significant sales declines
content: Jeep is executing a turnaround plan of the quintessential American SUV brand after five years of consecutive declines in the U.S. market.
summary: Jeep is executing a turnaround plan of the quintessential American SUV brand after five years of consecutive declines in the U.S. market.

title: Harris' rise in polls sparks wave of wealth transfers to kids
content: Currently, individuals can send up to $13.61 million (and up to $27.22 million for couples) to beneficiaries without owing estate or gift taxes.
summary: Currently, individuals can send up to $13.61 million (and up to $27.22 million for couples) to beneficiaries without owing estate or gift taxes.

title: Pro-Russian hackers reportedly crashed Taiwan Stock Exchange website on Thursday, local media reports
content: This was reportedly part of a DDoS attack on the Taiwanese government in retaliation for comments made by Taiwanese President William Lai.
summary: This was reportedly part of a DDoS attack on the Taiwanese government in retaliation for comments made by Taiwanese President William Lai.

title: Federal Reserve will opt for slow policy easing as there's 'still work to do' on inflation, Fitch says
content: Fitch also gave some predictions on Asian central banks, such as the People's Bank of China and the Bank of Japan
summary: Fitch also gave some predictions on Asian central banks, such as the People's Bank of China and the Bank of Japan

title: Alibaba’s Taobao shopping app launches AI-powered English version in Singapore, jumps to first place in Apple’s App Store
content: Alibaba's Taobao app topped Singapore's Apple Store charts after launching an AI-powered English version on Tuesday, boosting accessibility for users.
summary: Alibaba's Taobao app topped Singapore's Apple Store charts after launching an AI-powered English version on Tuesday, boosting accessibility for users.

title: Trip planning is still hard. Hear how Booking Holdings CEO plans to change that
content: Rather than travelers planning a trip from scratch, companies will know "everything" about the traveler from the start, said Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel.
summary: Rather than travelers planning a trip from scratch, companies will know "everything" about the traveler from the start, said Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel.

title: Harris or Trump: Does it matter for China who wins the election?
content: The U.S. in May announced stiff duties on about $18 billion worth of Chinese imports, including EVs, solar cells, lithium batteries, steel and aluminum.
summary: The U.S. in May announced stiff duties on about $18 billion worth of Chinese imports, including EVs, solar cells, lithium batteries, steel and aluminum.

title: India’s EV conundrum: To invest in cars or charging points first
content: India wants 30% of newly registered private cars to be electric by 2030. But out of around 4.2 million passenger vehicles sold last year, less than 2.5% were EVs, according to Bain & Company.
summary: India wants 30% of newly registered private cars to be electric by 2030. But out of around 4.2 million passenger vehicles sold last year, less than 2.5% were EVs, according to Bain & Company.

title: Oracle bumps up fiscal 2026 revenue forecast, lifting stock 6%
content: Oracle is projecting higher revenue and capital expenditures as its cloud-computing arm grows.

title: Microsoft to cut 650 jobs at its Xbox gaming unit — read the full memo from top exec Phil Spencer
content: Microsoft said Thursday that it is cutting 650 roles at its Xbox gaming division, in the latest major round of layoffs to hit the video game industry.
summary: Microsoft said Thursday that it is cutting 650 roles at its Xbox gaming division, in the latest major round of layoffs to hit the video game industry.

title: Russia turns the tables on Ukraine, launching counterattacks to retake Kursk after incursion stalls
content: Russia appears to have launched a major counteroffensive to retake areas of its Kursk border region that were seized by Ukrainian forces in a bold incursion.
summary: Russia appears to have launched a major counteroffensive to retake areas of its Kursk border region that were seized by Ukrainian forces in a bold incursion.

title: Harris raises $47 million in 24 hours after Trump debate
content: Vice President Kamala Harris raised $47 million from 600,000 donors in the first full day after her commanding debate performance against Donald Trump.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris raised $47 million from 600,000 donors in the first full day after her commanding debate performance against Donald Trump.

title: Ajit Jain, Buffett's insurance leader for nearly 40 years, dumps more than half of Berkshire stake
content: The 73-year-old vice chairman of insurance operations sold 200 Berkshire Class A shares on Monday for roughly $139 million.
summary: The 73-year-old vice chairman of insurance operations sold 200 Berkshire Class A shares on Monday for roughly $139 million.

title: Moderna shares plunge on plans to cut $1.1 billion in costs, launch 10 new products by 2027
content: Moderna is deprioritizing certain parts of its pipeline, which involves pausing work on some products and scrapping others.

content: Former President Donald Trump is continuing to challenge a ruling in his Georgia election interference case to disqualify District Attorney Fani Willis.

content: Airbus Ventures, one of the most prolific investors in space startups, raised a $155 million fund.

title: Navient reaches $120 million settlement with CFPB for misleading student loan borrowers
content: The CFPB sued Navient in 2017 for misleading borrowers and providing them with bad information.
